IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: University offering accredited bachelors, masters, and doctoral programs.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Union Institute & University educates highly motivated adults who seek academic programs to engage, enlighten, and empower them to pursue professional goals and a lifetime of learning, service, and social responsibility.
IRS990.Desc: Higher education: Academic services and instruction to students in accredited BA, BS, Masters, and Doctoral programs

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: Advances from Federal gov't for student loans

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University has adopted investment spending policies for endowment assets with the objectives of preservation of both the principle and fund purchasing power. The spending policies conform to the purpose and intent of each endowment.
The organization's non-discrimination policy is available on the University's website.

The University participates in Federal Title IV student financial aid programs. On-Campus assistance includes SEOG, FWS, and Perkins loans. Off-Campus includes pass-thru programs; Pell Grants, Direct Loans, and Grad PLUS Direct Loans. The University also participates in student educational grants in the states of Florida, California, Ohio, Vermont.

Federal and State Grants are awarded based on Federal Title IV and state higher educational compliance requirements. Institutional Scholarships are awarded based upon parameters established by each endowment fund and are monitored by a university scholarship committee. Scholarships are awarded without respect to race, creed & color.
Housing and auto allowance for Roger H Sublett of $40,000 and $8220 are treated as taxable compensation(box 1,3.5,16,18 of W2).
University contributes to 457f and 457b plan on behalf of Roger H. Sublett.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Process to review Form 990:The University's Form 990 is prepared by its internal accounting staff. It is reviewed by the University's CFO as well as by the members of the President's Cabinet. Copies are also provided to the Board of Trustees for their review and comments.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: An annual conflict of interest statement and disclosure form is required to be completed and signed by each trustee and officer. The form also requires updates for any changes in status that may occur throughout the year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation for Roger H. Sublett is determined by the Board of Trustees using a review of similar organizations' compensation of presidential wages and benefits from a variety of well-established data sources.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University's Form 990 is available for inspection upon request. The University's conflict of interest policy is included as part of its human resource policies and is available to all employees on its intranet site. Comparative financial statement information is available on the University's website.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: Form 8868 was filed and extension was approved.
